abstract: Russian fertilizer company PhosAgro is planning to bid for Canada’s Potash Corp, the world’s top fertilizer maker, rivaling a bid by BHP Billiton, business daily Vedomosti reported on Wednesday.
snippet: Russian fertilizer company PhosAgro is planning to bid for Canada’s Potash Corp, the world’s top fertilizer maker, rivaling a bid by BHP Billiton, business daily Vedomosti reported on Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: PhosAgro, a major fertilizer producer in Russia, is said to be preparing a bid for the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan to rival the $39 billion offer from BHP Billiton currently under consideration in Ottawa.

headline.main: PhosAgro Weighing Potash Bid, Russian Report Says

abstract: The Canadian government blocked BHP Billiton’s $39 billion bid for the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan.
snippet: The Canadian government blocked BHP Billiton’s $39 billion bid for the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan.
lead_paragraph: Yielding to political opposition, Tony Clement, Canada’s industry minister, said late Wednesday that his government would not approve a proposed $38.6 billion purchase of the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan by the big Australian miner BHP Billiton, The New York Times reports.

headline.main: Canada Blocks BHP’s Takeover Bid for Potash

abstract: The decision was only the second time that the Canadian government had turned down a bid in the 25-year history of the current foreign investment law.
snippet: The decision was only the second time that the Canadian government had turned down a bid in the 25-year history of the current foreign investment law.
lead_paragraph: OTTAWA  Yielding to political pressure, Canada said on Wednesday that it would not approve a proposed $38.6 billion purchase of Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan by BHP Billiton, the large Australian mining company.

headline.main: Canada Blocks BHP’s Purchase of Potash
headline.print_headline: Canada Blocks BHP’s Purchase of Potash
